com.bbfos.hbecher.geodiff.util

Class ShiftedIterator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bbfos.hbecher.geodiff.util.ShiftedIterator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements returned by this iterator
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<T>

    public class ShiftedIterator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<T>
    An iterator that traverses a virtually left-shifted list.

    For example, if we consider the list l = [1, 5, 9, 7, 3, 0], a shifted iterator over l starting at index 3 would iterate over [7, 3, 0, 1, 5, 9].
    This is especially useful when testing if two lists describe the same cycle.

    The Iterator.remove() operation is supported.

    This iterator is not thread safe.
    See Also:
    ShiftedIterator(List, int)

      • ShiftedIterator

        public ShiftedIterator(java.util.List<T> list)
        Creates a ShiftedIterator with the start index set at 0.
        This is equivalent to a regular Iterator.
        Parameters:
        list - the list to iterate over
        See Also:
        ShiftedIterator(List, int)

      • ShiftedIterator

        public ShiftedIterator(java.util.List<T> list,
                       int start)
        Creates a ShiftedIterator with the specified start index. The start index must lie between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the list (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        list - the list to iterate over
        start - the start index
        See Also:
        ShiftedIterator(List)
